metadata.name: Broken Foundations
metadata.description:
ğ—§ğ—µğ—² ğ—–ğ—¿ğ—®ğ—°ğ—¸ğ˜€

The Cracks are representations of the emotions and thoughts that we carry around with us every day. They live only in photographs and help communicate a story that a normal picture may not.

ğ—§ğ—µğ—² ğ—£ğ—µğ—¼ğ˜ğ—¼

Taken in Bristol, a city renowned for it's graffiti scene, the picture shows 2 women stood at the base of a large mural by Hazard One. 

ğ—§ğ—µğ—² ğ—–ğ—¼ğ—¹ğ—¹ğ—²ğ—°ğ˜ğ—¶ğ—¼ğ—»

Our Cracks is a series of mixed media photographs that use characters to represent emotions, thoughts and circumstances we are unable to see.

Each Crack is hand drawn and helps the viewer imagine a story from the photograph in front of them. Importantly, as all of our Cracks are unique, each story will be different.
